alert.note: Alert for Annette Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 22 at 12:27PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Prince of Wales, Southern Inner Channels and Central Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Petersburg, Kake, Port Alexander, Craig, Klawock, Hydaburg, Coffman Cove, Thorne Bay, Wrangell, Ketchikan, And Metlakatla. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong and moist weather system will move over the area on Wednesday to produce 2 to 3.5 inches of rain with localized higher amounts. Wednesday afternoon will be the period of the heaviest rain rates. Rivers and streams are already high previous rainfall and small streams may rise quickly to be near or exceed bankful levels. The potential for flooding may persist into Thursday if the heavy rainfall last longer.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Annette Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
